resources.string: Elevate your emotional well being with our intuitive mood tracker and journaling app. Easily track your mood and journal your thoughts and experiences to gain deeper insights into your emotions. With a virtual plant to visually represent your progress, our app empowers you to understand and nurture your mental health.
How do I grow my plant?
How much does my plant grow with each mood log?
Choose a plant and start logging your mood and journal entries daily. Each entry will water your plant, contributing to its growth. The more consistent you are, the faster your plant grows.
If you’re on a streak (logging for 2 or more consecutive days), your plant grows by 5% each day. Without a streak, it grows by 2.5% per day.
What if I miss a day of logging?
You cannot make up days. However, missing one day won\'t ruin your progress, but your plant’s growth rate will halve until you build up another streak.
What happens when my plant reaches full growth?
Once your plant reaches 100%, it blooms, marking your achievement. You\'ll then have the option to start with a new plant or continue to maintain the current one.
What happens if I don\'t log my mood for 7 days?

Your plant\'s growth will reset to the start of the current stage, and a wilted animation will appear to encourage you to resume journaling. For example, if your plant\'s growth was at 25%, 7 days of inactivity will result in a digress to 21%.
1. Tranquil Tulip\n2. Serenity Sunflower\n3. Peaceful Peony

Stage 1 (0-20%): Initial Sprouting
Small green shoots just visible above the soil surface.

Stage 2 (21-40%): Early Growth
A noticeable stem with a few leaves, still young.

Stage 3 (41-60%): Development nA taller stem, more robust with a fuller arrangement of leaves, and potential bud formation.

Stage 4 (61-80%): Pre-Blooming
Larger buds, some starting to show color, and a lush body of leaves.

Stage 5 (81-100%): Full Bloom
Fully opened flowers or a fully developed, lush plant.

Rainie Chi: nchi22@uw.edu
